intro: Erodium hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's stormweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
